Class matrixDesign

java.lang.Object
matrixDesign
public class matrixDesign extends Object
MatrixDesign is used to create three algorithms: The classic method, the divide and conquer method, and Strassen's method, which tests complexity of each algorithm.

    Description
    static int[][]
    classicMM(int[][] A, int[][] B, int n)
    Uses classic matrix multiplication
    static void
    displayMatrix(int[][] matrix, int n)
    This is used to display the matrix created but isn't used in the program
    static int[][]
    divideAndConquerMM(int[][] A, int[][] B, int n)
    Will perform divide and conquer matrix multiplication by recursively calling itself on smaller matrices made up of 1/4 of the original matrix
    static int[][]
    generateMatrix(int n)
    This method will generates a matrix filled with random numbers from 0-100 which will then be multiplied
    static void
    main(String[] args)
    Main will run an infinite loop create matrixes n * n increasing with 2^k and multiply those matrices based on the three algorithms created
    static void
    strassenMatrix(int[][] A, int[][] B, int[][] C, int n)
    Creates 7 new matrices P - V, based on Strassen's algorithm which will be used to find the matrix C, which is the result of the multiplication of A and B.
    static int[][]
    strassenMM(int[][] A, int[][] B, int n)
    Will use the strassenMatrix method to multiply the two matrices

      public static void main(String[] args)

      Returns:

      public static int[][] classicMM(int[][] A, int[][] B, int n)
      Uses classic matrix multiplication
      Parameters:

      B - Another matrix to be multiplied
      n - the size of the matrix
      Returns:
      a new array C which is the result of the matrix multiplication

    • divideAndConquerMM

      public static int[][] divideAndConquerMM(int[][] A, int[][] B, int n)
      Will perform divide and conquer matrix multiplication by recursively calling itself on smaller matrices made up of 1/4 of the original matrix
      Parameters:
      A - One matrix to be multiplied
      B - Another matrix to be multiplied
      n - the size of the matrix
      Returns:
      a new array C which is the result of the matrix multiplication

      public static int[][] strassenMM(int[][] A, int[][] B, int n)
      Will use the strassenMatrix method to multiply the two matrices
      Parameters:
      A - One matrix to be multiplied
      B - Another matrix to be multiplied
      n - the size of the matrix
      Returns:
      a new array C which is the result of the matrix multiplication

    • strassenMatrix

      public static void strassenMatrix(int[][] A, int[][] B, int[][] C, int n)
      Creates 7 new matrices P - V, based on Strassen's algorithm which will be used to find the matrix C, which is the result of the multiplication of A and B.
      Parameters:
      A - One matrix to be multiplied
      B - Another matrix to be multiplied
      C - the result of the matrix multiplication
      n - the size of the matrix
